title: Ticket #5796: python.d directory for custom classad functions
description:
I have created several custom functions for use with SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS. Presently, I have made these available to Condor by placing them in a system location such as /usr/lib/python2.7. Obviously I could build a package to do this.

Or, I could ask you to develop a feature. The idea is to have an /etc/condor/python.d directory that is "useful" in some way for developing custom classad functions. It could be a directory that is simply appended to PYTHONPATH or, perhaps, it could be automatically scanned for functions, particularly those that "register."

Basically, I'd rather manage this under /etc/condor than in a system location since the functions have no use in any other context.

Tom
